interpretation.interp: Lexical: a reading that differs from the accepted reading by offering an entirely different lexeme.
Syntactic: a reading that differs from the accepted reading in its grammatical construction or arrangement
Morphological: a reading that differs from the accepted reading in its grammatical form
Ordinal: a reading that changes the order in which units (letters, words, phrases, sentences, lines) occur the text
Orthographical: a reading that differs from the accepted reading only in spelling (i.e., not in any grammatically meaningful way)
Subtractive: omission of some unit of text through oversight, erasure, or some other cause
Additive: an interpolation, i.e., some text judged by the editor to have entered the tradition through the mistaken or deliberate copying of auxiliary material (e.g., glosses, marginalia, etc.)
